standard_metadata.standard_description: Find and position integers and other rational numbers on a horizontal or vertical number line diagram; find and position pairs of integers and other rational numbers on a coordinate plane.

question.content: The graph shows the four quadrants of the coordinate plane.    **Where is $\left(4,3\dfrac12\right)$ located on the coordinate plane?**

images.alt: An XY coordinate plane divided into four quadrants. The x axis runs from left to right.  The y axis runs up and down. Quadrant 1 is the top right quadrant. Quadrant 2 is the top left quadrant. Quadrant 3 is the bottom left quadrant. Quadrant 4 is the bottom right quadrant.

hints.content: The $x$- and $y$-axes divide the coordinate plane into four quadrants.  Any point on the coordinate plane is in one of the quadrants or on an axis. The $\blueE{\text{origin}}$, $(0, 0)$, is at the intersection of the two axes.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: An XY coordinate plane divided into four quadrants. The x axis runs from left to right.  The y axis runs up and down. Quadrant 1 is the top right quadrant. The x coordinate is positive and the y coordinate is positive.  Quadrant 2 is the top left quadrant. The x coordinate is negative and the y coordinate is positive.  Quadrant 3 is the bottom left quadrant.  The x coordinate is negative and the y coordinate is negative. Quadrant 4 is the bottom right quadrant. The x coordinate is positive and the y coordinate is negative. A solid point labeled origin is plotted where the x and y axis intersect.

hints.content: Let's graph $\left(\maroonD{4}, \tealE{3\dfrac{1}{2}}\right)$ by starting at the $\blueE{\text{origin}}$, $(0, 0)$.   The $\maroonD{4}$ in the ordered pair  tells us that our point is $\maroonD{4}$ units $\maroonD{\text{to the right}}$  of the origin.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 7 to 7 from the origin in both the x and y axis. A solid point labeled origin is plotted where the x and y axis intersect. An arrow moves 4 ticks to the right from the origin out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the y axis.

hints.content: The $\tealE{3\dfrac{1}{2}}$ in the ordered pair  tells us that our point is $\tealE{3\dfrac{1}{2}}$ units $\tealE{\text{above}}$ the $x$-axis.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 7 to 7 from the origin in both the x and y axis. A solid point labeled origin is plotted where the x and y axis intersect. An arrow moves 4 ticks to the right from the origin out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the y axis. An arrow moves up from the fourth tick mark on the x axis out to a point aligned with the number 3 and 1 half on the y axis.

hints.content: Since the $x$-coordinate is positive  and the $y$-coordinate is positive, our point is located in Quadrant $\mathrm{I}$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 7 to 7 from the origin in both the x and y axis. Quadrant 1 is the top right quadrant. The x coordinate is positive and the y coordinate is positive.  Quadrant 2 is the top left quadrant. The x coordinate is negative and the y coordinate is positive.  Quadrant 3 is the bottom left quadrant.  The x coordinate is negative and the y coordinate is negative. Quadrant 4 is the bottom right quadrant. The x coordinate is positive and the y coordinate is negative. A solid point is 4 units to the right of and 3 and 1 half units up from the origin.

hints.content: $\left(\maroonD{4}, \tealE{3\dfrac{1}{2}}\right)$ is located in Quadrant $\mathrm{I}$.

hints.content: Since the $x$-coordinate is negative  and the $y$-coordinate is positive, our point is located in Quadrant $\mathrm{II}$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 7 to 7 from the origin in both the x and y axis. Quadrant 1 is the top right quadrant. hints.content: $(\maroonD{-1}, \tealE{5})$ is located in Quadrant $\mathrm{II}$.

Points in Quadrant $\mathrm{I}$ have positive $\maroonD{x}$- and $\tealE{y}$-coordinates.  [[☃ image 1]]
